claim: this table include petrol engine that have single point fuel injection

Single-point fuel injection refers to a fuel injection system where the engine has only one injector. In such systems, the fuel is injected at a single point in the cylinder, which can be less efficient than multi-point systems but is commonly used in some engines.

Looking at the table, I see that it's structured with several columns: model, engine, displacement, valvetrain, fuel system, max power at rpm, max torque at rpm, and years. The rows represent different types of engines or specific models within those types.

So this specific row (row index 1) has a petrol engine with single-point fuel injection, supporting the claim. 

I don't see any other relevant cells because the rest either are diesel or have different types of fuel systems. So the relevant cell is at row index 1 under 'fuel system' column.
